attributes.additional_details: It is perfectly understandable to say that time pressure is a likely occurrence in life people in the country. However, the time pressure showed by examinations prevents them from carrying out their role in testing knowledge of students. A student needs the appropriate time to prove his/her knowledge in order for it to be a legitimate examination.
attributes.background: Young people in the UK are continuously battling the clock rather than the exam. The typical mark-a-minute ideology is obsolete and does not give students with extensive knowledge the time to apply it to a paper. As a result, students receive grades that less than represent their true capability.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Exam time limits are the responsibility of exam boards.
